intro: Actinocephalus callophyllus, commonly known as the broad-leafed actinocephalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are broad and lobed, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
